text: Jura ; is an island in the Inner Hebrides of Scotland, just north-east of Islay. Compared with its fertile and more populous neighbour, Jura is mountainous, bare and infertile. It is covered largely by vast areas of blanket bog, hence its small population.Haswell-Smith, Hamish 2004. The Scottish Islands. Edinburgh: Canongate, p47. Anderson, Joseph (Ed.) (1893) Orkneyinga Saga. Translated by JÃ³n A. Hjaltalin & Gilbert Goudie. Edinburgh. James Thin and Mercat Press (1990 reprint). In a list of the islands of Scotland ranked by size, Jura comes eighth, whereas ranked by population it comes thirty-first. It is in the council area of Argyll and Bute. == References == Category:Islands of Scotland Category:Argyll and Bute
title: Jura, Scotland
